title: Job Openings at Pyfinest Resources
content:
Pyfinest Resources - Our clients in various sectors are recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the following positions below:

1.) Planner / Scheduler (Civil Projects)

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a competent and detail-driven Planner/Scheduler to support the planning, monitoring, and delivery of civil engineering projects.
	The ideal candidate must be exceptionally skilled in Primavera P6, Microsoft Project, and MS Excel — with proven experience in developing project schedules, monitoring progress, and providing critical insight for timely project delivery.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop detailed project schedules, timelines, and graphs for presentation purposes.
	Update schedules with physical progress, manpower utilization, and man-hour expenditures.
	Monitor, prepare, and report project progress using S-Curve and other monitoring tools.
	Prepare weekly and monthly look-ahead schedules for site teams and management.
	Monitor site progress to identify deviations, delays, and potential risks.
	Recommend corrective action plans to address schedule slippages or inconsistencies.
	Highlight and update the Project Manager on critical activities and the critical path.
	Manage the Critical Path Method (CPM) to ensure project schedules are met.
	Provide accurate project forecasts, resource plans, and schedule analyses.


Ideal Candidate Profile


	Degree in Civil Engineering or related field.
	Minimum 3–5 years of proven experience as a Planner/Scheduler in civil construction projects.
	Certification in Project Management will be an added advantage
	Expert proficiency in Primavera P6 (mandatory).
	Strong hands-on experience with Microsoft Project and MS Excel.
	Strong analytical, reporting, and forecasting capabilities.
	Excellent communication skills and attention to detail.
	Ability to work under pressure and deliver reliable reports consistently.


Why Join?


	Salary: N250,000 monthly.
	Work with an established construction company delivering impactful civil projects.
	Professional growth, stable work environment, and competitive compensation.
	Opportunity to contribute to high-value engineering projects in the region.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a sample schedule (Primavera or MS Project)  to: pyfinest.hr@gmail.com using“Planner/Scheduler – Port Harcourt” as the subject of the email.

Note: Only qualified candidates with hands-on P6 and scheduling experience will be shortlisted.

 

2.) ICT Lead 

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
Strategic Leadership:


	Develop and execute the organization’s ICT strategy, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
	Evaluate emerging technologies (e.g., cloud solutions, cybersecurity tools) to drive operational excellence.


Team & Project Management:


	Lead and mentor a team of ICT professionals, fostering collaboration and performance.
	Deliver complex ICT projects on time/budget, mitigating risks and ensuring compliance with industry standards (ISO, NIST).


Systems & Security Oversight:


	Optimize ICT infrastructure (hardware/software/networks) for reliability, security, and scalability.
	Implement robust disaster recovery and data protection protocols.


Stakeholder & Vendor Management:


	Negotiate contracts with vendors, ensuring cost efficiency and service-level agreements (SLAs).
	Advise senior management on ICT investments and ROI.


Ideal Candidate
Must Have:


	Bachelor’s Degree Preferrably Master’s in Computer Science, IT, or a related field.
	7+ years of hands-on ICT experience (5+ in leadership roles).
	Proven expertise in:
	
		ICT infrastructure management (networks, cloud systems).
		Project delivery (Agile/Waterfall methodologies).
		Cybersecurity frameworks and compliance.
	
	
	Strong financial acumen (budgeting, cost optimization).


Nice to Have:


	Certifications (e.g., MCSE, CCNA, ITIL V4, PMP, CISSP).
	Experience in oil/gas or engineering sectors.


Perks


	Competitive salary (N600,000 Net) + HMO.
	Leadership role in a rapidly expanding engineering firm.
	Exposure to cutting-edge marine engineering technologies.
	Great team committed to growth and a supportive environment.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: pyfinest.hr@gmail.com using “ICT Lead – Your Name” as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

 

 

3.) Graduate Civil Engineer

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Our client is delivering high-quality solutions in Civil Engineering Construction and Logistics. As they scale operations across Nigeria, they are seeking ambitious young Civil Engineering graduates who are eager to grow, innovate, and build long-term careers within a proudly Nigerian brand.
	This is a growth-focused opportunity for graduates who want more than a job — they want a future in engineering leadership.


Key Responsibilities


	Assist in planning, design interpretation, and on-site execution of civil engineering projects.
	Support senior engineers in supervision, measurements, reporting, and quality checks.
	Participate in site inspections, project documentation, and materials evaluation.
	Collaborate with logistics teams for resource coordination and project efficiency.
	Learn and apply best practices in project management, HSE, and construction standards.


Ideal Candidate Profile


	Recent B.Eng / B.Tech / HND Civil Engineering graduate
	NYSC completed recently
	Strong passion for civil works, construction, and field exposure
	Excellent analytical, numerical, and communication skills
	Ambitious, disciplined, and eager to grow within an indigenous organization
	Ability to adapt, learn fast, and take initiative.


Salary
N150,000 / month.

Why This Opportunity Stands Out:


	Join a fast-growing indigenous brand shaping Nigeria’s civil engineering landscape
	Work directly with experienced professionals and project managers
	Clear career growth path into supervisory and project leadership roles
	Exposure to diverse construction and logistics operations
	Competitive remuneration and a supportive learning environment.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: pyfinest.hr@gmail.com using “Graduate Civil Engineer – Application” as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply
